def_en: A train is a number of carriages, cars, or trucks which are all connected together and which are pulled by an engine along a railway. Trains carry people and goods from one place to another.

def_cn: (缓慢行进中的)行列，队列
def_en: A train of vehicles, people, or animals is a long line of them travelling slowly in the same direction.

def_cn: (想法、事件等的)(一)连串，(一)系列
def_en: A train of thought or a train of events is a connected sequence, in which each thought or event seems to occur naturally or logically as a result of the previous one.
The train of a woman's formal dress or wedding dress is the long part at the back of it which flows along the floor behind her.
If a process or event is in train or has been set in train, it is happening or starting to happen.
If something brings problems or difficulties in its train, the problems or difficulties occur as a natural or logical result of it.
If someone trains you to do something, they teach you the skills that you need in order to do it. If you train to do something, you learn the skills that you need in order to do it.

def_cn: 锻炼，培养(某一素质或能力)
def_en: To train a natural quality or talent that someone has, for example their voice or musical ability, means to help them to develop it.

def_cn: (为体育活动)(使)进行训练(或锻炼)
def_en: If you train for a physical activity such as a race or if someone trains you for it, you prepare for it by doing particular physical exercises.
If an animal or bird is trained to do particular things, it is taught to do them, for example in order to be able to work for someone or to be a good pet.
If you train something such as a gun, a camera, or a light on a person or thing, you aim it at them and keep it towards them.

def_cn: (经整枝)使(植物)朝特定方向生长
def_en: If you train a tree, bush, or plant in a particular direction, you tie it and cut it so that it grows in that direction.
